wikipedia_page.main:
Steve Kerrigan (born 9 October 1972) is a Scottish former professional footballer who played for several clubs in the Scottish Football League and the Football League in the 1990s and 2000s.
He was had various spells coaching at Junior level since ending his playing career, with the first of his managerial stints at Camelon Juniors in July 2009, succeeding Greig Denham. A short spell as boss of Arthurlie followed in 2016.In January 2018, Kerrigan became manager at Bo'ness United having joined the club as assistant to Allan McGonigal in September 2017.

response: Hogg resigned his position at Kilsyth at the start of the 2017–18 season. He re-entered the game as part of Steve Kerrigan's coaching staff at Bo'ness United in January 2018.
